Package com.example.qrky

Class MapsFragmentMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.qrky.MapsFragmentMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback
    public class MapsFragmentMap
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
implements com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback
    A fragment class that displays a map with QR code markers retrieved from Firebase Firestore.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aaron Binoy

      • onCreateView

        @Nullable
public android.view.View onCreateView​(@NonNull
                                      android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      @Nullable
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      @Nullable
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called to create the view hierarchy associated with the fragment. Initializes the map fragment, checks location permission, and sets the click listener for nearbyCodesButton. Starts a handler to refresh the data every 5 minutes.
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater - The LayoutInflater object that can be used to inflate any views in the fragment.
        container - The parent view that the fragment's UI should be attached to.
        savedInstanceState - The saved instance state of the fragment.
        Returns:
        The View for the fragment's UI, or null.

      • onMapReady

        public void onMapReady​(com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap googleMap)
        Called when the map is ready to be used. Initializes the map and sets the click listener for the current location button. Enables the current location layer if permission is granted. Loads QR code markers from Firebase Firestore.
        Specified by:
        onMapReady in interface com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback
        Parameters:
        googleMap - The GoogleMap object representing the map.

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult​(int requestCode,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                       @NonNull
                                       int[] grantResults)
        Called when the user responds to a permission request.
        Overrides:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        requestCode - The request code passed in requestPermissions(android.app.Activity, String[], int)
        permissions - The requested permissions. Never null.
        grantResults - The grant results for the corresponding permissions which is either PERMISSION_GRANTED or PERMISSION_DENIED. Never null.
